children.subject: That is correct. It is my understanding that you would have to be taking the class now (F17) or schedule it concurrently with CS 88 in SP18.
To clarify about the last bullet point - someone who took CS C8 in fall 2016 would not be able to enroll? And if so, is there a reason enrollment is being restricted?
Please ask the faculty.
As per @5213 it appears attendance is required for 61c

Will there be iclickers next semster for 61c? 189 is not webcasted so students enrolled in both classes have to attend 189. There were no iclickers this semester for 61c so I'm hoping that will continue?

At least in past semesters, this was not the case; you must waitlist a class when there is a conflict, before filling out the petition form.

What you might be remembering is that if you have a conflict, staying on the waitlist is pointless in the enrollment system, because you'll never be let off of it. But when you first attempt to access the petition form, you'll be placed on the waitlist.

For the conflict override form. What does it mean by "you have to be waitlisted in the class you are requesting to enroll? Can we waitlist a class when there is a conflict? Because if I remember correctly, students can't waitlist a class when there is a conflict.
You might still want to phase 1 a class to secure your position on the waitlist (and then fill out the form in phase 2). But you won't be able to get in until phase 2.
Does this mean we essentially have to phase 2 one of the classes that has a conflict? (our forms will not be processed until phase 2)
If you qualify to get into the second course, you will do so and be dropped from the first course.

I have enrolled in 12 units already and have elected to swap a class I am enrolled in for another, and was subsequently put on the waitlist. Does this mean that when the waitlist is processed, if it is before my phase 2, that the system will skip over me? Or will it automatically remove the class I am enrolled in in favor of the new one?
What is the 61B issue?
Not able to enroll the class on Cal Central on Phase1 even if undeclared transfer student.
Try now.
It's still not working.
+1 Same here, not working. Also, If I'm on the waitlist does the system automatically enroll me in if this issue gets resolved?
First year Junior transfers ONLY: If you're still unable to enroll in the course, you can email cs-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu for assistance.

Is there anyone got responses from that email above? 

I was actually told to email that before Nicole said for this issue but didn't get any responses. And This time as well.

What should I do??
Me too, still not working and I even drop my wait list. How can I do now?
In the same situation as the person above^. What should we do now? Any suggestions?

Do we know when 61B issue is going to be resolved?

Also, what should I do before it's fixed ?
I think you'll be fine.
Is it okay to phase 2 CS 61A if I intend to take it this semester? I'm an intended-CS freshman whose phase 1 is tomorrow.

CS70 Discussion Section

When are we allowed to enroll for CS70 discussion section? It is only allowing me to choose section 999 as of right now.
No.
Can advisors/faculty comment on this?
I'm not sure you want them to comment on. (Especially faculty, who probably don't know anything about the enrollment system.)

No. 

If you drop & re-enroll into a section that has space you may temporarily drop to the bottom of the wait list until the next time the wait list is processed (4 times per day). Some students report that they get enrolled immediately but that's not guaranteed. 

See the warning associated with note 7 if you drop/re-enroll into a section that doesn't have open seats.

I had to drop 2 classes (CS 170 & 188) and re-enroll so I could try to get into an open discussion section instead of the previously full section that I had selected. When I did this, I went to the end of the waitlist for the 2 classes. 

I'm a little confused by statements made here: if my spot of the waitlist will not be kept if/once I drop and re-enroll, then what's meant by "temporarily drop to the bottom of the wait list"? Does that just mean I will go up the waitlist as it's processed (an obvious observation)?

Cindy is referring to: if you are the only person on the waitlist who can be enrolled, you will be enrolled, regardless where you are on the waitlist. In a situation when you drop and rewaitlist in a section such that you are able to enroll into that section, then you would do so (assuming no one ahead of you on the waitlist can).

In this case, CS188 is full, so you can't get into the section even if there is space in that section (since you can't enroll in lecture). CS170's seats are reserved for CS / EECS students, which you might not be, in which case, again, you can't enroll in the class, regardless of your waitlist position.

I see.

A few days ago I was ~100 on the waitlist for 170 & 188 until I dropped/re-enrolled and now I'm ~300 in both. Am I screwed for enrollment in either? 

If it helps in giving a more relevant answer: I'm a CS-intended transfer and I'll be done with my pre-reqs this semester (CS 70 & 61A).
It depends on your section waitlist. If your sections have space, you'll skip people higher than you on the waitlist who chose a full section
Regarding #7: does this mean that my spot on the waitlist will be kept if I drop and re-enroll into an open section?
(bump I have enrollment today and would like to know!!)

The CS enrollment policies for 61B and other lower-divs is linked in the post.

61B has usually expanded in past semesters. If there's a sudden surge of demand for some reason, it might be less likely to expand fully. But there's also the increase in the Phase 1 enrollment cap to 13.5 units instead of 10.5 units, and more students might be Phase 1-ing the course, so comparing against past years is less meaningful.

As a followup: will more labs/discussions be added to 61B? Right now, it seems that most of the sections have only one open seat. 

Enrollment for people not in the course reserves begins on Wednesday, right? Or is it just right after everyone finishes their Phase II on Tuesday?

61B may be expanded; it often has in past semesters. But that's never a guarantee.

I don't know when the last students have their Phase 2 appointments begin, but I would imagine that the department would also want to give them some time to actually enroll (e.g. a day or so?).

When will students not in the course reserves for 61B be able to enroll in the course? In the event that the course fills up before that, will the class likely be expanded further? (looking at past course enrollment timelines on BerkeleyTime, it seems that the course is filling up /far/ more quickly this year than it usually does)

history.content:
This is the master list of announcements for SP18 lower div CS classes.  Class-specific information is at the end of this post.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS lower div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower

  2. Waitlist Processing:

    1. Wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed.

    2. If a student has a time conflict between the class and another, the system will NOT enroll them – they will be skipped when the list is processed. Time conflicts require manual enrollment. (See the note about the CS Time Conflict Override form.)

    3. If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

    4. Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  4. 999 sections will be used for CS 61A and CS 70. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central.

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    1. Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

    2. Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

      1. During first lecture

      2. Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form)

      3. Via course home page

  6. Changing sections in CS 61B and CS61C. These classes require students to enroll in 3 components: lecture, lab section, and discussion section.

    1. In order to successfully enroll into the lecture, students need to select both a discussion and lab section that has available seats. If students select a lab/discussion section that is full, they will automatically be waitlisted for the class.

    2. Students who are enrolled in the class may use the swap feature to change sections.

    3. Students who are waitlisted cannot use the swap feature and must drop/re-enroll to change sections.

      WARNING: Dropping and re-enrolling into another section that does not have space will cause you to drop to the bottom of the waitlist! If that happens, we cannot reinstate you to your prior place on the waitlist, even if you selected a full section by mistake.

  8. In the event of a time conflict – students need to complete the CS Time Conflict Override form. This is a different form than the form indicated on Cal Central.

  • This form is to request to overrides into CS classes only.

  • It is the student’s responsibility to check the attendance policy of the conflicting classes and make plans for conflicting midterms/finals.

  • Conflict overrides will only begin to be processed starting in Phase II.

  • Every 3 business days, here’s how CS time conflicts are processed:

    1. If there is space available in the class and the student will not go over the unit limit, the student is enrolled.

    2. If there is no space in the lecture or section the student has requested, or if the student will go over the unit limit with enrollment, the student is deleted from the list.

          If you submit the CS Time Conflict Override form and are not enrolled within 3 business days, you need to re-submit the form to indicate you still want to get into the class!

 

The remainder of this post will contain class-specific information that will be updated as more information becomes available.

 

  • CS C8 – This class is being managed by STAT department this semester. Students should enroll into STAT C8.

 

  • CS 61A - 999 sections will be used for the first time this semester in this class. See note above about how enrollment works.

  • CS 61B - [update 10/24]  Transfer students, we are aware there is an issue with your ability to enroll in this class. We are researching how to resolve the conflict in the enrollment system. If you are a transfer student having difficulty enrolling into this class please email csconners@berkeley.edu and include your SID number.

    [update 11/9] Expanded enrollment - we got permission to increase the overall class side to 1200 students. Be aware that the wait list won't be processed again until 1pm today so if you are wait listed, you won't see any change until after 2pm today. An email was sent directly to everyone on the wait list with more information.

 

  • CS 61C - Unfortunately there is a time conflict with this class, CS 189/289A,  and CS 170. Although we do our best to avoid time conflicts between classes, given the number of CS classes offered and constraints in classroom scheduling, it is not always possible to prevent overlaps.

    • Read this page for more information about time conflicts: https://sis.berkeley.edu/faq/student/enrollment-faq

    • Be sure to read the section above about the CS Time Conflict Override form & how to handle conflicts.

  • CS 70 – 999 sections will be used in this class. See note above about how enrollment works.

  • CS 88 – Students enrolling in this class need to have taken CS C8 in F17 or to be currently enrolled in CS C8.

We are researching how to resolve the conflict in the enrollment system. If you are a transfer student having difficulty enrolling into this class please email csconners@berkeley.edu and include your SID number.

    [update 11/9] Expanded enrollment - we got permission to increase the overall class side to 1200 students. Be aware that the wait list won't be processed again until 1pm today so if you are wait listed, you won't see any change until after 2pm today. An email was sent directly to everyone on the wait list with more information.

 

  • CS 61C - Unfortunately there is a time conflict with this class, CS 189/289A,  and CS 170. Although we do our best to avoid time conflicts between classes, given the number of CS classes offered and constraints in classroom scheduling, it is not always possible to prevent overlaps.

    • Read this page for more information about time conflicts: https://sis.berkeley.edu/faq/student/enrollment-faq

    • Be sure to read the section above about the CS Time Conflict Override form & how to handle conflicts.

  • CS 70 – 999 sections will be used in this class. See note above about how enrollment works.

  • CS 88 – Students enrolling in this class need to have taken CS C8 in F17 or to be currently enrolled in CS C8.
history.subject: SP18 Enrollment: Getting into Lower Div COMPSCI classes
